page.title: 04 Meall Bhanabhie: Flora 2
page.content: {Small Plants} As well as heather, its close relatives, cross leaved heath and bell heather are found, as are blaeberry, cowberry and crowberry. In more fertile parts, there are swards of sheep's fescue grass with thyme, self-heal and purging-flax. Many woodland plants flower before the trees above them come into leaf. Wood anenome, wood sorrel, common violet, lesser celandine, primrose and blue-bell are all to be found flowering in late spring. The humid climate is particularly favourable to mosses and liverwarts which often completely cover boulders. Lichens too, do well in the clean air. Where there is lime in the soil more demanding species can be found ie ash, wych-elm, dogs mercury and woodruff.
